module.name: risk_management
module.keywords: module, risk management, risk identification, risk impact, risk classification

purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of concepts associated with the management of risk over the full life cycle of a system.

usage_guide.p: This module is constructed from several ISO/TS Application modules. The USE FROM connectivity associated with these modules are shown below in Figures 1 through 7.

Entries into the type extend lists stem from two primary needs; namely, harmonization with STEP AP's relevant to AP233 and satisfaction of AP233 needs. The first group of extends needed for harmonization are derived from the extend lists used within the following STEP modules - not used by AP233:

The extends associated with this grouping are all placed in type extend lists having one of the character strings "pmri", "os", "pb", "ws" or "ss" used the extensible select type's name. This module contains only contributions from this group.

There is a problem with how Risk is modelled which only came to light when fixing other problems in AP233. Basically the Risk resource tries to cover all aspects of Risk, including approvals. This therefore requires the resource part to reference the Approval MIM, which is not allowed. The riskresource should deal with the concepts of risk and that is all. Risk approval should be handled in the risk module, which should then use the risk and approval resources.

This requires further changes to both the risk module and risk resource, but it is the right direction to take things. Further changes have been made to part 58 to allow AP233 to go out for CD ballot, following convenor review. These changes are basically a hack to get the EXPRESS to parse correctly, and will need further work before AP233 progresses further.

The whole area of risk should have significant ISO and industrial review. Not because it is wrong, there is a lot of good work in there, but it needs better integration with the rest of STEP resource parts and current modelling styles in the modules area. Aspects such as classification, approval, identification etc. are handled in the resource schema in ways not compatible with AP233, AP239 and others, which seems very strange since this resource was developed originally to support these standards.
